overview: From 2025-09-09 to 2025-09-10, elizaos/eliza had 3 new PRs (4 merged), 38 new issues, and 5 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Custom Plugin Schema migration issues
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Steps to reproduce: 1. Schema Files ``` import { pgTable, text, uuid, timestamp, pgEnum } from "drizzle-orm/pg-core"; export const suggestionTypeEnum = pgEnum("suggestion_type", ["buy", "sell"]); export const suggestionStatusEnum = pgEnum("suggestion_status", ["pending", "resolved", "rejected"]); export const pluginSuggestionsTable = pgTable("plugin_suggestions", { id: uuid("id").primaryKey().defaultRandom(), type: suggestionTypeEnum("type").notNull(), ticker: text("ticker").notNull(), status: suggestionStatusEnum("status").notNull().default("pending"), createdAt: timestamp("created_at").defaultNow().notNull(), }); ``` 2. Insert the schema in plugin (check the image) 3. In my env I have POSTGRES_URL 4. Run: bun run dev 5. LOGS (in order, check images)

topPRs.title: feat: modernize README with better structure and quick start
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## üéØ Problem

The current README, while comprehensive, presents several usability challenges:
- Dense, overwhelming initial experience for new users
- Verbose sections that bury key information
- No clear 5-minute quick start path
- Missing standalone core usage documentation
- Inconsistent information architecture

## üöÄ Solution

This PR transforms the README into a modern, user-friendly introduction that:

### Key Improvements:
- **Professional presentation**: Added centered header with badges and clear positioning statement
- **Streamlined Quick Start**: Reduced to essential 5-minute flow with clear steps
- **Better information architecture**: Logical flow from overview ‚Üí features ‚Üí getting started
- **Standalone usage**: Added section for using ElizaOS core directly in applications
- **Reduced cognitive load**: Moved advanced CLI commands to collapsible section
- **Maintained completeness**: All essential information preserved, just better organized

### User Experience Impact:
- ‚ö° Faster time-to-first-success for new users
- üìà Increased adoption through clearer value proposition  
- üéØ Better developer experience with focused guidance
- üí™ More professional, trustworthy project image

### Changes Made:
- Modernized header with professional styling and badges
- Condensed feature list with clear benefits
- Created focused 5-minute quick start guide
- Added standalone core usage examples
- Improved section organization and hierarchy
- Reduced redundancy while maintaining depth

This maintains all technical depth while making the project much more approachable for newcomers.

topPRs.title: feat: Add real-time channel creation with Socket.IO integration - WIP
topPRs.author: tcm390
topPRs.body:
## Related Work
https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-action-bench/pull/2

## Summary

This PR implements real-time channel creation functionality with Socket.IO integration, enabling instant UI updates when new channels (especially DM channels) are created. The changes include both server-side event emission and client-side event handling for a seamless user experience.

## Key Changes

### üöÄ Features
- **Real-time channel creation events**: Server now emits `channelCreated` events via Socket.IO when new channels are created
- **Automatic channel switching**: Client automatically switches to newly created DM channels
- **Query invalidation**: Automatically refreshes channel lists when new channels are created
- **Enhanced channel creation API**: Added support for predetermined channel IDs in the API

### üîß Technical Implementation

#### Server-side (`packages/server/src/api/messaging/channels.ts`)
- Added Socket.IO event emission for `channelCreated` events
- Enhanced channel creation endpoint to accept optional predetermined channel IDs
- Improved error handling and validation for channel creation parameters

#### Client-side 
- **Socket.IO Manager** (`packages/client/src/lib/socketio-manager.ts`): Added `ChannelCreatedData` type and event handling
- **Socket Chat Hook** (`packages/client/src/hooks/use-socket-chat.ts`): Implemented channel creation event processing with filtering logic
- **Chat Component** (`packages/client/src/components/chat.tsx`): Added automatic channel switching and query invalidation

### üêõ Bug Fixes
- Fixed minor prompt and settings configuration issues
- Updated TypeScript configuration for better compatibility

topPRs.title: feat(client): Add URL synchronization for DM channel switching and direct navigation
topPRs.author: tcm390
topPRs.body:
result:


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7f1a502b-51f6-431f-be05-dc0dccf923e8


## Summary
Implements URL synchronization for DM channels, allowing users to bookmark and share direct links to specific conversations while maintaining proper channel switching functionality.

## Changes
- **URL Updates**: Automatically updates URL when users switch between DM channels
- **Direct Navigation**: Supports direct URL navigation (e.g., `/chat/{agentId}/{channelId}`)
- **Non-blocking Implementation**: Uses `window.history.replaceState()` to avoid component re-renders
- **Conflict Resolution**: Prevents URL navigation from interfering with normal channel selection

## Technical Details
- Added `addChannelIdToUrl()` function for efficient URL updates without navigation
- Added `useEffect` to monitor `chatState.currentDmChannelId` changes
- Added `useEffect` to handle direct URL navigation with validation
- Maintains backward compatibility with existing routing structure

## Testing
- ‚úÖ Channel selection works normally
- ‚úÖ URL updates automatically when switching channels  
- ‚úÖ Direct URL navigation works (paste URL in new tab)
- ‚úÖ Graceful fallback when channel doesn't exist
- ‚úÖ No performance impact (no re-renders)

## Benefits
- Users can bookmark specific conversations
- Shareable direct links to DM channels
- Better UX with persistent URL state
- Maintains existing functionality

topPRs.title: Correct action name and improve prompt for multi-step
topPRs.author: tcm390

topPRs.title: fix(client): Remove redundant navigate() call in force new chat flow
topPRs.author: tcm390
topPRs.body:
## Problem
When creating a new chat via "New Chat" button, the `navigate(location.pathname, { replace: true })` call was wiping out the channelId from the URL after `addChannelIdToUrl` had just set it, causing URL inconsistency.

## Solution
- Removed redundant `navigate()` call since `addChannelIdToUrl` already cleans the `forceNew` state via `window.history.replaceState(null, ...)`
- This prevents the channelId from being lost in the URL and maintains proper URL state

## Testing
- ‚úÖ "New Chat" button works without recreation issues
- ‚úÖ URL correctly shows `/chat/agentId/channelId` after channel creation
- ‚úÖ Page refresh doesn't trigger recreation
